cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SE of New Orleans, LA and 185 mi WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, on track to approach the southeast-central Louisiana coast then curve north into western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City to the Mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch is posted Sabine Pass TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA (includes the Beaumont/Port Arthur area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: No Tropical Storm or Hurricane warnings currently extend into Texas; warnings begin at Cameron, LA eastward
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast may experience outer rain-bands, elevated tides, and gusty winds
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Sunday night into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels 2–4 ft above ground possible along Sabine Pass and adjacent bays/channels
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 2–6 inches with isolated higher totals, producing localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; rough seas and dangerous rip currents affecting Sabine Lake approaches
